title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 ยง 208.2 - Medical examination required for license
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 ยง 208.2 - Medical examination required for license

State Regulations
(a) To obtain a license or the renewal of a
license as a professional boxer or professional mixed martial artist, all such
persons shall submit to a thorough medical examination by a physician approved
by the Commission, in such form as approved by the Commission, and shall submit
to such other medical tests and examinations as may be required by such
physician and/or the Commission. (b) All boxers and mixed martial artists
applying for a license must complete and submit a physical examination in a
form as required by the Commission, and submit a completed electrocardiographic
examination, MRI, dilated eye examination by a licensed ophthalmologist and
laboratory and other tests and examinations as may be required by the reviewing

Commission physician and/or the Commission. Notes

New

York State Register September 21, 2016/Volume XXXVIII, Issue 38, eff. 9/21/2016

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
